content.description:
Another quality line from the Tim/Tom duo. It doesn't look like much but the movement is superb. The crux can be powerful or delicate, depending on your style. It's given 13a in the latest guide.

Start in the left side of the cave and follow the corner out of the roof with some fun bouldery moves. Don't underestimate the short corner just before the anchors.
content.location: The next line to the right of Methmatics 12b; the left-most line that starts in the cave.

content.description: Start up a smooth alcove with some delicate funky climbing, then head up a rail past some compression moves to a large flake. Do a few undercling moves and pull the roof and continue up some hand jams and funky holds to a final 5.11+ lieback moves guarding the anchors.
content.location: Can't miss it, look for a giant flake and 5 fixed draws.

content.description: Start off a boulder and it's nice to have the first high bolt stick clipped as your already starting 10 feet up off the block. Climb the blunt arete and broken crack features past 4 bolts. Climb up and right to the top of the large roof and start liebacking past two more bolts (hard to clip) and then a few crimps to the anchor.
content.location: First route outside of the large cave on the arete. Look for a high bolt right above a big boulder.

content.description: One hell of a route! Starts in an obvious layback corner and continues through the roof. The crux can be a touch reachy for the short. Given 13a in the guide.
content.location: To the left of Methmatics 12b, the arete under the roof.

content.description: This will shock ya like a glass bottle thrown by a prepubescent.  Nice patina face to some wild broken glass shaped knee bars.  Thin boulder problem to some fluff and rest before the final techy steep dihedral.
content.protection: mix of 12 slings and draws helps you smoothly show what you can do
content.location: To the right of the cave at the back of the trailerpark. Nice patina to overhanging chunk.
